Description: Fragment of undyed linen plain weave, with a decoration of undyed linen and red, yellow, blue and purple wool loops; decoration is of one large roundel (17.5cm dia) with four geometrical motifs (lozenge or crosses); the two at the top and bottom have the centre in blue wool surrounded by four squares in undyed linen and then surrounded by eight squares in red wool; the two on the left and the right have a centre in blue wool surrounded by four squares in red wool and then surrounded by eight squares in yellow wool; the large roundel is surrounded by a small square of purple wool; plain weave: warp-undyed linen (S/30), weft-undyed linen (S/9); supplementary weft loops - blue, re, yellow, purple wool (S/c.5mm) and undyed linen (S/c.4mm); all edges cut and ragged
Acquisition name: Purchased through: Sir Ernest A T Wallis Budge
